Name: 脱走名人 (Escape Master)
Description:
è„±èµ°åäºº (Dasso Meijin) is a game from Japan about escaping pet lizards. Each player is a different pet lizard which has got free from its tank in the game designer's home (the game title means 'escape master'). They run around the rooms and try to catch insects. The first lizard to get a set of insects is the winner.

The game designer (who breeds pet lizards) describes the game as a mix of roll & move and Old Maid, in that the lizards follow paths around, and steal cards off each other akin to Old Maid.

However, the game does not use dice. Instead, players choose a numbered card from their hand in secret, reveal it and advance as far as they wish up to the number. The lowest numbers go first.

Players follow paths around the different rooms in the home, and try to catch insects in the rooms or collect useful objects (by drawing cards). If a player gets into a room with another lizard, they can steal a card from the other player's hand. But some cards are also traps.

The pet owner is also moving about, and if a player ends up in the same room, they cannot move or they will be caught. So being able to predict the movements of the other players and the owner matters.

The first lizard to secure a hand of four cards of one type of insect is the winner.
user summary

Name: Campaign Trail: Dirty Politics Module
Description: The Dirty Politics Module adds 24 trickery and take that cards to the game. It was included in the original Campaign Trail base game through stretch goals, and became a separate module with the release of the second edition.

Name: La Résistance: Gestapo Event Cards
Description:
The Gestapo deck adds 9 new, unique events, which make the game more challenging for experienced players.

Use this deck instead of the event deck that ships with the game.

Name: Campaign Trail: Advanced Solo Mode
Description:
Advanced Solo Mode is a 50-card deck featuring new rules, new depth and solo mode debates. It can be used in both solo and multiplayer games (with humans). Each advanced solo deck acts as one AI opponent; multiple decks can be used in a game.

The Advanced Solo Mode deck offers an easy, medium, and hard mode. The standard solo play deck (contained in each base game) does not include debates and is approximately medium mode.

Name: Dungeon Drop: Flame Demon
Description:
Flame Demon levels up! This limited mini-expansion includes a special class cards and an amazing metal Flame Demon cube that replaces the standard wooden cube included in Dungeon Drop: Dropped Too Deep!

Additionally, this pack includes a metal Draglin Flagon and a special Flame Demon feat card to be used in Tavern Tales!

Name: La Résistance: Mes Amis ! C'est La Guerre Deck
Description:
Mes Amis ! C'est la Guerre cards can be purchased in-game by spending a sum of dice that is 6 or greater. 
These cards give players advantages and/or allow you to mess with your opponents, adding a fun "Take that!" element to the game.

The base game ships with its own C'est la Guerre cards. 
The Mes Amis deck includes new cards such as American tanks, British commandos, and Allied planes. 
A big help, and big fun.

Mes Amis C'est la Guerre is a 9-card deck.

Name: Dungeon Drop: Wizards and Spells
Description:
Introduces 2 new game modes to Dungeon Drop, each of which allows the game to be played with 5 players for the first time! This expansion includes 9 heat printed 10mm cubes, 6 game cards, 5th player initiative token, hero meeple, scoring token and a rulebook.

New game modes:

- Sinister Spells: This competitive game mode allows all players to utilize the new spell cubes against one another. Drop a cube into the dungeon on another player's turn to petrify one of their abilities, syphon their life, or open an infernal gate allowing an EXTRA huge monster to emerge! There are 9 different spell effects, each represented by a unique heat-printed 10mm cube. Plays with 2 to 5 players!

- Wicked Wizard: This game mode introduces the concept of "1 vs. many" to Dungeon Drop. One player  takes on the role of the Wicked Wizard, wielding their devious spells in hopes to keep the locations of their Sinister Spellbooks hidden and maintain their dark grip on the dungeon. Meanwhile, the group of heroes works together to find the hidden locations of the Sinister Spellbooks and gain the knowledge necessary to banish the Wicked Wizard from the realm! Makes use of the 9 new spell cubes and the coop goals from Dropped Too Deep. Plays with 3 to 5 players!

Name: Endangered: TH2 + SiN
Description:
Endangered: TH2 + SiN is a micro-expansion for Endangered that consists of two Ambassadors based on the Tantrum House hosts and a "Strength in Numbers" bonus.

Originally available as an Add-on from the Kickstarter campaign for Endangered:  New Species.

Name: Endangered: Center for Biological Diversity
Description:
Endangered: Center for Biological Diversity is a small expansion for Endangered that features new role powers for the Zoologist and the Environmental Lawyer.

Originally available as an Add-on from the Kickstarter campaign for Endangered:  New Species.

Name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: Die Raumflotte der Druuf
Description:
Klappentext:
Thema des ersten Ergänzungsbandes ist die Raumflotte der Druuf. Ein von Insekten abstammendes Intelligenzvolk, unterwarfen sie  ihr eigenes Universum, bis sie durch ein Naturereignis in die Lage versetzt wurden, in die heimatliche Milchstraße einzudringen. An der Überlappungszone beider Universen kommt es zu den größten Raumschlachten seit dem Methankrieg. Eine Gefahr für die Galaxis: Zehntausende von Raumschiffen; ausgestattet mit modernster Technik - dem Lineartriebwerk - warten auf ihren Einsatz.
Auch dieser Band bietet wieder alles über Stärke und Zusammensetzung, Logistik und Organisation, Technik und Personal.

This expansion adds the faction "Druuf" to the game. This includes new units and background informations.

Name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: Arkon's Robotflotte
Description:
Klappentext:
Groß war der Schock im Jahre 1984, als die Ganymed mit Thora und Crest an Bord nach Hause ins Arkonsystem vorstieß. Die degenerierten Arkonidenherrscher waren abgesetzt und der Robotregent von Arkon war an ihre Stelle getreten. Vor tausenden von Jahren gebaut und programmiert, setzt er nun alles daran, an die große Zeit der Alt-Arkoniden anzuknüpfen. Die Raumflotte - lange vernachlässigt - wird wieder auf den neusten Stand gebracht und die Rüstungsindustrie wird wieder zum wichtigsten Industriezweig.
Neben den üblichen Hintergrundinformationen werden in diesem Ergänzungsband mehrere Hilfsvölker der Arkoniden vorgestellt (Zaliter, Ekhoniden und Zekloner).

This expansion including new units and background information for Arkons Robotflotte.

Name: The Best of Christmas Game
Description:
Best of Christmas is the newest member of the LOGO board game family, featuring all your favourite picture, theme and pot luck cards.

Covering all the things we love about Christmas it even has the cutest Christmas tree that you decorate as you play the game.

It's a perfect bite-sized festive flash of fun to get you in the Christmas spirit.

HOW TO PLAY: You are testing your Christmas knowledge to climb up and decorate your side of the Christmas Tree. You’ll be asked questions which you’ll have to answer correctly in order to dress up the tree. The first team to decorate all the way to the top puts up the gold star and wins the game.

Name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: Die Raumflotte der Terraner II
Description:
Klappentext:
Mehr als 50 Jahre lang hatte Terra Zeit seine Raumflotte aufzubauen, immer mit der Angst im Rücken, daß eines Tages der Robotregent Terra entdeckt und in sein Imperium einverleiben will. Noch ist die Zahl der terranischen Großraumer sehr gering, aber die Anzahl an Kleinstraumern (Jäger und Zerstörer) und das bekanntermaßen exzellente Personal der terranischen Raumflotte können das zum Teil ausgleichen.
Dieser Ergänzungsband zeigt den Aufbau der terranischen Flotte von einigen zusammengeklauten Schiffen hin zu einer modernen und schlagkräftigen Flotte; abgerundet wird das Bild von den Werften auf dem Mond und den Verteidigungsanlagen auf den anderern Planeten des Sonnensystems.

This expansion adds new units and background to the terran faction.

Name: Popcorn Poppin'
Description:
Don't be left holding the Popcorn when it Pops! Popcorn Poppin' is a fast and fun game where players must pass the popcorn bucket before the popcorn pops. While the time counts down, players follow the instructions from the die and pass the popcorn as quickly as they can before the popcorn pops!
-Manufacturer's description

In  "Popcorn Poppin'", not to be confused with "Poppin' Popocorn", one player fills the plastic popcorn bucket with plastic popcorn pieces, start the time by pulling the cord on the back, and then press down the cardboard-and-plastic "die", which when released pops up and will roll onto a face showing what the player must do to pass the bucket of popcorn. Players keep doing this until the timer ends and the popcorn pieces are launched out from the bucket, making the player holding the bucket when this happens out for the round. It plays much like a game of Hot Potato with a jack-in-the-box from hell. The game continues until only one player is left. The last player left is the winner!

Name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: An der Überlappungsfront
Description:
Klapptentext:
Die Auseinandersetzung zwischen den Druuf un den arkonidischen Robotraumern bilden den Hintergrund des ersten Szenariobandes. Hier werden die Gefechte und Auseinandersetzungen, die 17 Monate lang an der Überlappungszone zwischen den beiden Universenandauerten, aufgearbeitet. Neben einer Reihe von Szenarien wird in diesem Band auch auf den Verlauf der Kämpfe und die Verluste auf beiden Seiten eingegangen.

This expansion adds new scenarios to the game.

Name: Perry Rhodan Simulation: Die Raumflotte der Maahks I
Description:
Klappentext:
Dieser Hintergrundband zur Perry Rhodan Serie stellt ausführlich die Raumflotte der Maahks zu Beginn des Methankrieges vor. Das Aufeinandertreffen zwischen den Arkoniden und den Methanatmern führte zu kriegerischen Auseinandersetzungen, die mehr als 300 Jahre dauern sollten. Auf Grund ihrer enormen Vermehrungsrate waren die Maahks in der Lage, ihre Verluste schnell auszugleichen - ganz im Gegensatz zu den Arkoniden, deren exzellente Besatzungen allmählich dezimiert wurden. Doch trotz ihrer zahlenmäßigen Überlegenheit mußten schließlich die Maahks das Schlachtfeld räumen. Ihre wenigen Überlebenden konnten sich durch den Sonnentransmitter retten und wurden von den Meister der Insel (Mdi) in der Zwergengalaxis Andro-Alpha angesiedelt.
In diesem Hintergrundband, der reichhaltig illustriert ist, werden folgenden Themen ausführlich behandelt:

Allgemeines. Wie kam es eigentlich zum Aufeinandertreffen zwischen Arkoniden und Methanatmern? Ausführungen über das Aussehen und Körperbau, Atmung und Körperchemie sowie ihrer Geschichte runden das Kapitel ab.

Aufgabenstellung. Nach dem ersten Gefecht mit den Arkoniden änderte sich auch die Aufgabenstellung in ihrer Flotte.

Stärke und Zusammensetzung. Jedes Jahr bekam der Imperator einen Tobsuchtsanfall, wenn die immensen Zahlen noch um einige Prozentpunkte nach oben kletterten.

Logistik. Werften Stützpunkte und andere Einrichtungen im Herrschaftsgebiet der Methanatmer werden vorgestellt. Nicht zu vergessen die Weltraumbahnhöfe zwischen den Galaxien.

Führung, Struktur und Organisation. Wie waren die Flotten aufgebaut, die sich mehrere Jarhunderte blutige Gefechte mit den Arkoniden liefern konnten.

Technik. Wie waren die Raumschiffe ausgerüstet, mit den die Maahks die Galaxies unsicher machten.

Personal. Selbst bei den Methanatmern gibt es einige Persönlichkeiten.

Datenblätter. Einzeln vorgestellt und mit Datenblättern versehen, werden die Raumer der Flotte aufgeführt.

Darüberhinaus bietet Ihnen dieser Band mehrere Szenarien für das Raumkampfsystem der Perry Rhodan-Simulation und für das Brettspiel "Der Methankrieg".

This expansion adds the race Maahks to the game. Including units, background information and a scenario.

Name: Breukosaurus Rex
Description:
Breukosaurus Rex is an education game that helps children to practise fractions and calculate percentages and decimals.

In the game, players try to get on the other side of the island. Each turn, the active player will roll the two dice and will afterwards see how much they get. The player choses either to step forward, take cards or do both.

On the cards they can either see fractions, calculate percentages or decimals and then they must see if they match several cards to make 1 whole or 100%. If they can do that they win an egg. To win the game a player must get to the other side with 3 eggs.

—description from the publisher

Name: Schrödinger's Cat: A Game of Curiosity
Description:
Schrödinger's Cat in a pocket-sized game of curiosity that unfolds in ten minutes and stretches beyond the natural lifespan of the players. Equal parts infinite and intimate, two players, or two teams, take on the role of either the Cat Wrangler or the Scuba Master, making permanent, irreversible, life or death choices for their cat. Their goal, of course, is to keep their cat alive as long as possible.
 Inspired by quantum physicist Dr. Edwin Schrödinger’s metaphysical thought experiment stating that a cat sealed in bunker with a container of radioactive poison - that may or may not have opened - is both alive and dead at the same time, this destructible game begs the question… does curiosity really kill the cat?

Perfect for curious players who revel in experiences that push the boundaries of what a game can be.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rioolratten
Description:
Rioolratten is an education game that helps children with reading comprehension.

In the game, players have to try to get out of the sewer. How do they do that? The player takes a card and has to give the right answer to the question. To respond to the question he has to look threw the flyers, catalogue... If the player gives the right answer he needs to look on the back of the card how many steps he may go forward.

If the player doesn't give the right answer than he stays on is place. To win the game the player has to get to number 55.

—description from the publisher

Name: Minerały: Promo 1 – Pomost (Wollastonit)
Description: Additional tile with special "teleport" ablity.

Name: Blitzkrieg vs. Russia, 1941
Description:
"Blitzkrieg vs. Russia, 1941" *attempts* for the Barbarossa Campaign, to be what Frank Chadwick's classic little Battle for Moscow, 1st edition is for that battle:  a basic, relatively fast and simple, very conventional hex-and-counter introductory board wargame.

It is the same scale - 13 hexes from Warsaw to Moscow - as classic old SPI Barbarossa and might be used with that.  Stalingrad *is* on the South-Eastern edge of the board, thanks to canting.  And it fills to the maximum an A3/11x17 mapboard, although halves are provided for a larger, 17x21 one and larger pieces can be made from the single-set sheet.

Monthly turns, 37+2 German and Axis units, 30+5 Russian units.  Russian units hidden until adjacent/engaged with a couple blanks/dummies.

Blitzkrieg mechanics for the Germans, pressed attacks, factory evacuation and massive replacements for the Russians, on one of my more beautiful maps.

(I finally figured out how to make the background other than stark, glaring white.  Think fields of light green Russian grass with the darker green forest(, etc.).

This would have been good in the Four Roads to Moscow gameset.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: (TA)ALIENS
Description:
(TA)ALIENS, is an educational game that helps children with spelling, vocabulary and French.

In the game, players(the aliens) must get on a new planet because a comet is coming closer and endangering the planet. To be allowed to enter the new planet they need to collect 4 stars.

How to collect stars?
Players need to walk over the stars to reach the small planets.

On each star they need to practice a word. If this word is written correctly the player can stay and the turn is over.
When a player arrives on a planet he needs to write two words correctly. When the two words are correct the player receives a star.

In the pile of words are several cards stating the player can play another turn, the player has to move the comet forward or gets a chance to practice a word three times before writing it.

-description from publisher

Name: Mierzoet
Description:
Mierzoet, is an educational game that helps children of all ages to learn more about healthy food, the food triangle and the nutrient code.

In the game, the player(the ants)needs to go to one of the piles, to collect 5 cards at the end of the game. Each turn, the active player will roll the die, and move his ant forward. When one of the players gets to the pile, he may pick a card. The goal is to select a card with as less sugars as possible. The player can take the card home and the ant flies back to the start circle in his own color.

Once each player collected 5 cards, they may turn the cards to compare which player has the healthiest cards. The player with the healthiest cards wins this round and gets a piece of fruit. The players can play as many rounds as they want. The ant colony which has the most pieces of fruit in the end wins the game.

Afterwards they can also see how healthy their food is with the food triangle or the nutrient code.

—description from the publisher

Name: Oil Town
Description:
Oil Town is a competitive, card-driven, dice-placement board game from Pio Games. It's designed by Anton Jankowski and features traditional hand-painted watercolor art by Yayoi Jankowski.

The American Wild West, 1890. After a tiring trail, you have finally arrived in Oil Town – a boomtown that attracts pioneers from all around the land with its never-ending flow of black gold. With your allocated drilling rights in your hands, you gather a bunch of helpers and set foot on the intimidating oil field. After walking around for a while, you notice the dowsing rod suddenly starts to twitch. In this moment you realize – it’s time to strike it rich!

—description from the publisher

Name: Viral: The Hive
Description:
Have you conquered the body in Viral? Are you ready to turn up the heat? The Viral: The Hive expansion introduces five asymmetric and highly thematic viral factions.

In this expansion, each player starts with a new hive within the body from which to spread their influence and unlock new abilities for their viral faction.

Name: My Rummy Junior
Description:
This is a Junior version of rummikub with pictures and number on the tiles. The tiles are numbered from 1 to 6 only.
The players lay their cards skilfully on the table in series, the aim is to be first to get rid of all your tiles. The ï¬rst player to win three RUMMY chips after a number of rounds is the RUMMY King.

Name: Great War at Sea: Jutland – Viribus Unitis
Description:
Our 35th issue features Austro-Hungarian battleships, the proud fleet flagship Viribus Unitis and her sisters, the projected Ersatz Monarch class-dreadnoughts that would have followed them, and the Radetzky-class semi-dreadnoughts that came before them.

Golden Journal No. 35: Viribus Unitis has 20 new die-cut and silky-smooth playing pieces, with all of those variant dreadnoughts and semi-dreadnoughts for your gaming pleasure, plus additional scenarios for Jutland and Wine-Dark Sea so you can play with them.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
Series: Great War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Excavation Earth: Pretty Boxes & Ancient Artefacts
Description:
Excavation Earth: Pretty Boxes & Ancient Artefacts contains two sets of alternate artifact tiles — "Ancient things" and "Things that make noise" — as well as a "Pretty Box" expansion that adds one new artefact of each color, with that artefact being placed on top of the matching black market stack when revealed instead of on the map.

This item was a Kickstarter Limited Exclusive included in the Explorer, Envoy, and Collector pledges, and it's labeled "PROMO 01".

Name: E.S.P.C: Extra Sensory Perception Combat
Description:
Enter into the world of Psychic Warfare.  To survive on this battlefield, you will need to see the future, read your opponent's mind while obscuring your own thoughts, move in for the kill when they least expect it, and, most importantly, survive by any means necessary.

ESPC is a fast-paced game where you try to be the last player standing.  A round should take about 5 minutes or less.  The last player left alive gets a victory point.  Cards in the game represent Psychic Powers. Each turn a player draws a card and declares what power they are going to use.  At this point, any player may challenge the use of this power.  If the player claiming to play the power doesn't have that card in hand, they are out for the round, but if the player has the card, the challenger is out.  At this point, the player uses their power card and discards face up.  This continues until only one player is left, and points are awarded.  Then the deck is reshuffled and the next round begins.  The game is played until one player reaches the target number of victory points to win.

Each time the game is played, only a subset of powers are used. The number of powers in a game is based on the number of players, and there are rules governing how powers are selected.  This leads to a unique experience each time the game is played. For a 4 player game there are 4,000+ different power combinations.

-description from designer

Name: Streifzüge durchs Salzburger Land
Description:
With Streifzüge durchs Salzburger Land (Forays through the regionof Salzburg), you get to discover or re-discover Salzburg, the heart of Austria, its districts and villages.
Get to know historical details, unknown sagas and stories about the state of Salzburg.

Name: Tabik
Description:
Tabik is a finite territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on an initially empty square board.

Both players must have shared access to a sufficient number of black stones, white stones and rods. Stones are square-shaped and placed on the spaces (squares) of the board. Rods are as long as stones are wide and placed on the edge segments between adjacent squares.

				
				
					DefinitionsIn these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

A group is a stone along with all other stones one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent like-colored stones. Thus, all stones in a group are the same color.

The size of a group is the number of stones in it.

				
				
					PlayOn your turn, if possible, perform exactly one of these actions:

- Place two stones of different colors on adjacent empty squares and a rod on the edge segment between them.

- Swap the positions of two adjacent stones of different colors not separated by a rod and place a rod on the edge segment between them.

If you have no moves available, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed.

The game ends when both players pass in succession. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. Your score is the biggest group size in which you have the greater number of groups. If there is no such size, your score is zero. If both players are tied at zero points, whoever made the last move loses.

				
				
					Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

-description from designer

Name: The Great Airplane Race
Description:
The Great Airplane Race is a short family-style game for 2-50 players.

Each round, players fold planes on their airplane templates, then throw towards the finish line! If no one crosses that line, players re-fold and try again. Players choose which color lines to fold based on where their airplane lands compared to the color disc. They usually have three color lines from which to choose, but if a player lands their airplane on the color disc, they can choose any single color line to fold.

If your plane crosses the finish line, you win instantly; otherwise whoever has gotten closest to the finish line after five rounds wins.

Name: Wythe
Description:
Wythe is a finite territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square board. Both players must have access to a sufficient number of identical rectangular pieces. Seen from above, a piece has an area of 2x1 board squares. One of its two square halves is colored black, the other white.

				
				
					DefinitionsIn these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

A bit is one of the two small one-colored square prisms that make up a piece.

A stack is a set of one or more bits piled onto each other on the same square. The color of a stack is the color of its topmost bit, which denotes its owner.

The height of a stack is the number of bits in it.

A group is a stack along with all other stacks one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent like-colored stacks. Thus, all stacks in a group are the same color.

The size of a group is the number of stacks in it.

				
				
					PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, if possible, place a piece on the board so that it exactly covers two empty squares or two stacks that rise to the same height, without causing any bit to lie directly on a like-colored bit. At all times, at least one bit of every piece on the board must remain uncovered.

If you have no moves available, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed.

The game ends when both players pass in succession. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. Your score is the biggest group size in which you have the greater number of groups. If there is no such size, your score is zero. If both players are tied at zero points, whoever made the last move loses.

				
				
					Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

				
				
					NotesWythe is based on TAIJI.

-description from designer

Name: Quarod
Description:
Quarod is a finite territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square board.

Each player must have access to a sufficient number of square-shaped pieces of their own color. Each piece has a line (rod) connecting its center to the center of one of its edges.

				
				
					DefinitionsIn these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

Two adjacent opposite-colored pieces are engaged to each other if their rods form a single continuous line.

A group is a piece along with all other pieces one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent like-colored pieces. Thus, all pieces in a group are the same color.

The size of a group is the number of pieces in it.

				
				
					PlayOn your turn, if possible, perform exactly one of these actions:

- Place two pieces of different colors on adjacent empty squares so that they are engaged to each other.

- Swap the positions of two adjacent pieces of different colors that are already engaged but not to each other, and rotate them so that they are engaged to each other.

If you have no moves available, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed.

The game ends when both players pass in succession. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. Your score is the biggest group size in which you have the greater number of groups. If there is no such size, your score is zero. If both players are tied at zero points, whoever made the last move loses.

				
				
					Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

-description from designer

Name: BelloLudi Rifles: Skirmish Game 1860-1914
Description:
BelloLudi Rifles rules have been developed for people who have no previous experience in wargaming, yet like to play games. 
BelloLudi designed these rules especially for team building purposes. It is therefore easy to learn, quick to play, yet difficult to master! Suitable for two to forty players!

The game is designed as a multiplayer game but will work just as fine with only two players or even solo. The same goes for the number of miniatures involved. It is possible to start with only 20-odd miniatures, but that can easily be expanded. Hopefully, playing the game will encourage you to create your own armies. Similarly, the distances are given in inches for use with 28mm scale soldiers. Feel free to adapt to centimetres should you not have the space or when you use a smaller scale of miniatures.

This ruleset simulates battles in the period of 1860 to roughly 1914, the age in which European countries forged empires all over the world and combated each other and the various indigenous people. The rules will work for skirmishes in colonial settings, the Franco-Prussian War and other Wars of German Unification, the Balkan Wars, the Spanish-American War, the Boer Wars, the Boxer Rebellion and other clashes. It will also work for the early clashes of WW1.

Designed for the beginner with a minimum of miniatures, it also allows you to field large armies on the table top and play to a conclusion in two to three hours.

The aim is not to annihilate the enemy unit to the last man, but to inflict so much damage that morale is brought down and the unit will become shaken or will run away in panic and be removed from the table top. By a clever combination of movement and shooting, dashing cavalry charges and carefully positioned artillery pieces, this can be achieved. The tactics are based on teamwork. Not only within a unit, but also between units and as such, the whole army.

This product come with two commander dice. Markers can be downloaded.
Cards are available separately.

—description from the publisher FB page

Name: Three Indoor Games: Tank Attack
Description:
Tank Attack is a simple roll and move game where the aim is to navigate a path from the combat base to the final objective. Along the way obstacles such as tank traps, anti tank guns and enemy bombers will impede a players progress, The first to reach the objective (square 100) is the winner.

The game can be found as part of a 3 game set in an envelope packaging titled, Three Indoor Games, the other games being Snakes and Ladders and Ludo. Published by Ace Games in Australia during the Second World War.

—user summary

Name: Star Arena: Arcade Chess
Description:
Arcade-Chess is a Game-Of-Generals, invented to teach New-Players how to 'Move over the Maps' within the StarArena_MetaVerse and get you acquainted with how to Operate the Battle-Clones in Close Quarters Combat.

The working theory is: "Having practiced and getting good at this Battle-Simulation will give you Strategic-Advantage when playing Missions on Larger-Maps!"

If you are a fan of Abstract War-Games? This could very well give you hours of Table-Top~Fun and keep you entertained for Years to Come!

(Will extend description later when approved)

Name: Treasure Island
Description:
Treasure Island is a roll and move game first published during the 1920s in Australia. Players follow a path of 41 squares through the sea passing various ports along the way until you reach Treasure Island. There you roll specific numbers in order to collect treasure and acquire a ship to take you on a course of 31 squares for home.

Along the way contrary winds can detour your journey, you can drift off course, hit rocks and get wrecked, all of which make returning to home more difficult. First home is the winner.

At least 2 versions exist. A version resides in the Australian National Martime Museum, Sydney, with somewhat simpler graphics and classified as first edition

—user summary

Name: Gunfight Royale
Description:
Players battle to the last gunfighter standing using dice, cards, poker chips, and miniature figures sculpted in the style of vintage cartoons. Players choose between twelve very distinct characters whose special abilities must be considered carefully depending on the scenario drawn and the choices made by opponents. Found items and dirty trick cards are used to surprise and outwit opponents, while the figures and board encourage players to use sound tactics. 
After being eliminated from the game, a player can continue to influence play through their dirty trick cards, so nobody is left out. 
The game ends when only one character remains standing, or a miniature on horseback reaches the end of the time track. At the end of the game, the winner is determined by the total bounties of opponents eliminated, plus bonuses for found items and scenario objectives.

—description from the designer

Name: Star Arena: Cyber-Combat Card & Boardgame
Description:
StarArena_The Card Game is an Outrageous & Gratuitous Web-Published Cyber-War Collectable-Card-Game (CCG) featuring #GodsViciousBabies!

The Card Game is a collection of random War-Stories converted to Battle-Cards that take place in the StarArena_MetaVerse. You are required to build an Attack-Stack (Game-Deck a/o Data-Base) with the prime-directive to 'Destroy' all other opponents Data-Bases!

				
				
					
 = = = = =
When Played with MODEM:Your mission for the base-game is to  'obliterate' the other player(s in card-combat, and the win-conditions are divided into 2 types of counters: Lives & Wins.

You have to think of it like; Playing an Arcade-Game!
Lives are Lost in Card-Battle and gained by Insert-Coin into the pot, 1 Coin gives you 3 Lives. Losing a single Card-Battle, means you Loose A Life: -1. The counter is the set to -1, when you loose your last Life; You are Out-Game and the Victor in that Card-Battle has just gained a Game-Win! And that players Win-Counter is set to: +1.

The first Player to reach 6 Wins on his/her counter gets to Chant: 
Whois the #GunShin? #è»ç¥ž? ...And is the War-Hero/God of that Game!!

Taking home the'Treasure' _ie: Game-Coins_ that has/have accumulated in the pot during Game-Play!!!

When the Players are not done with game-play for the day or night?
All Data-Bases are reshuffled (random-access-memory) and Counters reset to Minimum and a new Game-Session begins with the target to: Reach 6 Wins First and become the next Gunshin!!

Each player who wants to participate in Battle: Must Insert-Coin (Maximum stakes are 2 Coins, giving 6 Lives) into the Pot and draw a Hero-Card from hand and place in Modem (or Active HW Location) at the beginning of their game-turn. 
StarArena is a Multi-Player Collectable-Card-Game and is best played with 4 to 8 Players and the higher the chance becomes to reach 6 Game-Wins and proclaim to be the Gunshin!
				
				
					
 = = = = =The 'Only' really important thing you need to know before building an Attack-Stack is: 
There are 2 Types of General-Cards: Hardware-Cards & Software-Cards!

Hardware are your Hero-Cards and have: Dual-Hard-Drives and signify your Download-Capacity & Battle-Values. (Blow through these in Card-Battle and you suffer Defeat!

Software are your Battle-Options and have: A Download-Cost, Free-Space needed to Activate SW a/o APP. (These Battle-Cards Make-Or-Break your chances of Victory!

A Deck may contain a maximum of 64 cards and no-less than 8 game cards. 
For the nitty-gritty on Card-Battle-Rules read: ROE, Rules-Of-Engagement.

Oh, ...and did I mention; It is a !!FREE!! Print_And_Play game?
Check-Out the link below and Build Yourself a Bad-Ass Data-Base.

And Become A Man Amongst Babies! 
Just Don't Tell Your Mom?

Name: UNO: The Lion King
Description:
It's the classic card game you know, now with a Lion King theme! UNO Lion King features a colorful deck with images of beloved characters from the original Disney movie -- Simba, Timon, Pumba and more -- as well as a special Lion King-themed rule that could change the entire direction of the game! Just like in classic UNO, match cards by color or number and play action cards like Skip, Reverse and Wild Draw Four to shake up the competition. When the Circle of Life card is played, cards pass in a circle from player to player. Score points by being the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand and when you're down to one card, don't forget to roar, "UNO!" This version of the family-favorite card game makes a great gift for 7 year olds and up. Colors and decorations may vary.

It's the classic card game you know, now with a Lion King theme!

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: UNO: Incredibles 2
Description: This special deck includes the Wild Screen Slaver Card, which hypnotizes cards and adds a fun twist to the game!
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: UNO: Toy Story
Description: Play UNO to infinity and beyond with Woody, Buzz, and the toys from Andy's room. Become the master of the aliens with the special Claw card and rule! And be sure to yell "UNO!" when you're about to reach for the sky and win!
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: UNO: Finding Dory
Description:
The search for excitement is over with the Finding Dory edition of UNO! Play the Just Keep Swimming Card to keep the action moving! Use the Customizable Cards to create your own memorable rules! And don't Forget to yell "UNO!" before you play your last card!

—description from the back of the box

Details about the two unique/new items in this version:

     Just Keep Swimming Card – acts as a wild where the next person in order has to keep drawing until they pick a blue card.
     Blank Cards – allow you to create house rule cards.


Both card types are worth 50 points if they are in your hand at the end of the round.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: UNO: Iron Man 2
Description:
Plays like standard Uno with red, green, blue, and yellow cards (25 each color) numbered 0-9, with skip, draw, reverse, wild and wild draw four cards. In addition, there are four additional "War Machine" cards for a total of 112 cards for this version. War Machine cards count 50 points in scoring and make you impervious to the effects of draw 2 and draw 4 cards by making your opponent draw those cards.

The Iron Man 2 version of Uno is listed in the main Uno Wikipedia page under "Theme packs". The Iron Man character is prominent on the bulk of the cards, with other characters from the movie used on the skip, draw, reverse, etc... cards.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: UNO: Simpsons Edition
Description: This version of UNO features Simpsons images on the cards, a new card type (Blinky Card) and it is housed in a box shaped like Homer's head.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Tramwer
Description:
Tramwer is a “game of routes” around the two lines of the Montpellier tramway.

After having drawn a route card, designating the starting point and the destination station to be reached, you must be the first to reach the destination. 
There are many pitfalls in the smooth running of the game, such as the “strike days” boxes

It contains: a board, cards, pawns and a dice.

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Into the Maelstrom: Mythos Pack
Description:
Into the Maelstrom is the sixth Mythos Pack in The Innsmouth Conspiracy cycle.

Throughout your Innsmouth investigations, you have ventured into tide-hollowed caves and dripping tunnels - but these watery caverns are only the antechamber of the Deep Ones' domain. A hidden city rests beneath the choppy waves of the North Atlantic, slumbering at the bottom of the ocean. If you're going to protect the world from suffering the same fate as Innsmouth, you'll need to venture into the heart of the storm.

Within this Mythos Pack, you'll find the final scenario of The Innsmouth Conspiracy cycle, inviting you and your fellow investigators to dive into the darkness beneath the waves and confront the Deep Ones in their own city - putting an end to this threat forever. Combined with the addition of new player cards to upgrade your decks, Into the Maelstrom is a perfect capstone for a cycle of danger and mystery.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Innsmouth Conspiracy
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Senet e Tablan
Description: Tablan + Senat - two games in one box.

Name: Jetzt schlägt's 13
Description:
The super fun game to freak out.
The electronic pinball action game is brought to the board as a clever dice game. Whoever manages to collect 88 points first in this crazy game has won. Everyone pushes his disc into the action area and collects points. And can also score points if he plays against the group in the subsequent action game and wins.

Name: Heja Sverige
Description:
Heja Sverige is a strategic level 2-player wargame set in the latter half of the 30 Years War when Sweden re-ignited the war in Germany.

Then France got involved as well and it would take 18 more years for the hostilities to end, leaving a shattered Germany in its wake when the war finally ended in 1648.

One player is the Union Player and he'll control the Factions of Sweden, France and the Protestants.

The other player is the League Player and he'll control the Factions of Spain, Bavaria and the Holy Roman Empire (HRE)

The game is played for a maximum of 9 two-year turns on a map divided into Areas controlled by the various Factions and Neutrals.

Armies consisting of Infantry, Cavalry and Artillery combat units are moved around by Generals, engage in combat and take control of Areas looking to fulfil their objectives.

—description from the designer

Name: Cosmic Lorry
Description:
In Cosmic Lorry you are cosmic merchants who are trying to build a big commercial network. You establish trade routes by connecting different planets. The more trade routes you create and the further apart the connected planets are, the more points you will score. The player who connects the planets most skilfully wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rungholt
Description:
Rungholt, the legendary Atlantis of the North Sea, was an island with a commercial town on the North Frisian coast, which was destroyed by a storm surge in the 14th century. In this game, you try to save the island and its residents from flooding. The water masses will engross the island relentlessly – are you able to secure the town, its residents and resources to make the most points from it? Use the dice wisely and leave the island as the heroic winner!

—description from the publisher

Name: Lantris: Königliche Landschaften
Description:
In Lantris, you are a candidate for the coveted position of royal landscape architect and have the honorable task of designing the kingdom according to the wishes of your liege lord and thus help him to new glory. With your landscape cards, you build lands that please the King and earn you the most victory points. Whoever has gained the most points in the end is the new royal landscape architect of Lantris.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chai (Deluxe Edition)
Description:
In Chai, you will step into the shoes of a tea merchant, combining tea flavours to make a perfect blend. Specializing in either rooibos, green, oolong, black or white tea, you will buy and collect ingredients to fulfill your customers’ orders.

As a tea merchant, each turn you will do one of the following: Visit the Market, Select Additives, Reserve a Customer.

At the end of each turn, a player may complete a tea order from one customer card in their hand or visible in the customer pool. A base tea token, tea flavours and additives shown on the card are needed ingredients, and placed in an empty tea cup. The player flips over a tip and receives a coin bonus, moving the thermometer round tracker up one notch if all cups are filled.

The game ends when five rounds of cups have been fulfilled. When the final order is completed, other players complete their last turn so that each player has played the same number of turns.
To score, players add up their victory points from fulfilled customer orders, and add their leftover money to this total. In 3-5 player games, additional points are awarded to the player(s) who fulfilled the most orders and most diverse tea recipes. Award ties are friendly with each winner receiving 5 points.

The player with the most victory points (from customer orders, money, and awards) wins the game as best tea merchant! In the case of a tie, the person with the least number of fulfilled customer cards wins. If still tied, the person with the least amount of money wins. If that does not break a tie, the victory is shared.

Unique features to the deluxe include:


    10 deluxe exclusive cards
    5 deluxe superfan-inspired cards
    5 wild tea ingredient tiles
    3 unique customer tips
    3 NEW ability cards

Name: PixPlain
Description:
In PixPlain, you invent creative stories about why your picture card, which is actually not suitable, goes particularly well with the word on display. For example, describe what a snail has to do with speed and why a lemon is cute. Select one of your picture cards that does not match the word at all, with which you want to challenge the other players. The selected cards are shuffled and dealt again. Now you have 30 seconds to argue why your assigned picture card does match the word. Vote on which story you liked best. The winner keeps his card. The first person to have 3 cards wins the game.

-description from publisher

Name: Mazecraft: Finde den Weg
Description:
You have found the entrance to a dungeon maze, but unfortunately you don't have a map. You know that you have to find the sword and defeat the dragon to get to its treasure. But be careful, your fellow player is trying to do the same in your dungeon.  Play with the pre-build dungeons or build your own. Decide in which direction you want to go on your map, if you go the wrong way or step into a trap, it's your opponent's turn. Whoever finds the sword and the dragon first wins the game.

-description from publisher

Name: Teelepathie: Das abgebrühte Teamspiel
Description:
You invite your friends for tea Time and want to enjoy an intimate conversation – while the other guests at the table are listening unintentionally. How do you manage to transmit the secret word without revealing yourself and the word category? Tealepathy is a word and association game. Choose a secret category with your changing team partner. Now it's up to you to convey a secret word within this category to him or her by giving clues. But be careful, the other players will try to find out which category it is. Depending on the vote of the audience, points are distributed to all players. Whoever has the most points after a round wins Tealepathy.

-description from publisher
Families: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

Name: Mind Map AI
Description:
The INC Corporation has developed an artificial intelligence that â€¨is indistinguishable from the humanoid. An international hacker â€¨organization called HaXs 4 has hacked into the corporate network, aiming to destroy the AI. As the firewall of the INC Co. you are trying to create an impenetrable network over the coding so that the HaXs 4 have no chance to realize their plans. You have to work as a team to create a big firewall network. But everyone works on their own and just share little information. Roll the dice and establish fragments into your own Mind Map to build connections between the scripts to safe the coding of the AI. Every valid connection will score points to your team. The HaXs 4 get points by deleting connections. You win the game if you have more points as the HaXs at the end.

-description from publisher

Name: Vault Wars: Relic Roadshow
Description:
Legends speak of ancient relics, locked away for untold centuries -- who knows what treasures and terrors await? Great power can be yours if you’ve got a villainous eye for looking past the other temptations of the vaults!

Relic Roadshow adds new temptations to Vault Wars allowing you to bid your way to the dark side! New Vaults are uncompromised by special rules and instead award the second-highest bidder with powerful Relics to craft! Drawn by the corrupting power, Aspiring Villains reward you for crafting their desired Relics. Vices give powerful, unique abilities... if you’re willing to take on a bit of corruption, of course! Step right up and place your bid!

Players will take turns as an Auction Master, leading a cut-throat bidding war to selling off Vaults full of items to the other players.
Each Vault provides a unique experience, introducing new ways for the players to bid.
No player quite knows everything that's in a Vault, and there's lots of junk to fool your opponents into bidding on.
Between auctions, players may sell off their items to gain Gold, or save them for Victory Points -- paying storage fees to keep them around.
Collect gems for massive Victory Points, Weapons to gain lots of Gold, or rare Artifacts to gain powerful abilities.
Each player has up-and-coming heroes who are looking for specific items, giving out bonus victory points (but try to keep that a secret from your opponents).
The player with the most victory points after all the auctions will be the winner!

Name: Neo-Morphosis: Infestation – Nyx Expansion
Description:
An optional Kickstarter exclusive crossover character from the Middara board game which comes with the following that can be used with Neo-Morphosis Infestation:

1 detailed plastic Nyx miniature
1 ID card
3 x Ability cards

-description from publisher

Name: Anachrony: Infinity Upgrade Pack Box
Description:
Anachrony is a worker placement and tableau building game set in a foreboding future. As a leader of one of humanity's four ideological Paths, your goal is to prepare for an asteroid impact bound to happen over the course of the game, and become the dominant power on New Earth once the dust has settled. At your disposal are not only your loyal workers and high-tech Exosuits, but also the ability to open Time Rifts, implemented as an innovative game mechanism.

The Anachrony: Infinity Upgrade Pack Box includes every expansion and module released for the Anachrony: Fractures of Time KS and all stretch goals. This includes an exclusive box with plastic trays to hold all content provided and all previous content.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hibachi: Hot & Spicy
Description:
The Hot & Spicy expansion adds components for a 5th player, special player boards that give each player a special ability (and a place to store their chips, etc.), as well as some new spicy recipes that require chili! Make your dishes extra tasty, or try to cook one of the new recipes that require a sprinkling of spice!

The new Hot & Spicy recipe cards may be used instead of, or, shuffled in with, the recipe cards from the base game. Now chili is a required ingredient on the recipe cards! These recipes are earned the same way as regular recipes, but players now must spend 4 ingredient cards to learn them (3 ingredients, plus chili)

Components:
18 extra Ingredient cards
2 extra Chili cards
12 extra paper Yen
18 Hot & Spicy Recipe cards
7 yellow throwing chips
5 special chef mats
1 pair of chopstick

Name: D-D 1944
Description:
D-D 1944 is a game in which we must disembark the allied troops on the beaches of Normandy, the primary objective is to destroy the enemy turrets and strategically advance the troops so that they have range to shoot.
During the game we can play a series of missions to try to achieve a goal.
A game that simulates a small cooperative WarGame.

—description from the designer

Name: Das Festung Baues Spiel
Description:
Das Festung Baues Spiel, an early 18th century military fortifications board game, comprises 52 engraved playing cards numbered sequentially. The cards use the French suits — with the suit being an image of a fortification, many rather intricate and some quite attractive — along with a paragraph of explanatory text. Along the top of the sheet additional panels list the game's rules, and a panel along the left edge contains an index of important terms. A central panel bear the "Peter Schencken" imprint against an architectural backdrop adorned with military hardware.

The sheet could be dissected for use as a traditional deck of cards or left intact for use as a board game, using the rules printed at the top. These rules appear to be fairly straightforward, involving the rolling of dice to determine one's moves, the victor being the first to land on panel number 53, the Complete Vestung ("Complete Fortification"). Additional rules add spice to the game; for example, anyone landing on panel number 16 — the Aussenwercke ("Outworks") — must sit out two turns. By progressing through all the panels, players are exposed in sequence to the various elements of fortification, from basic geometry through the digging of counter approaches.

Name: Wissen & Quizzen: Faszinierende Pferde
Description:
A tiptoi quiz game about horses.

The four assistants "Käpt'n Quizzo" (KQ), "Jonny Joker" (JJ), „Wilma Weg“ (WW), and "Robert Ross" (RR) guide through the game with two difficulty settings.

Knowledge: Learn about horses as depicted on 26 different cards.

Trivia game: Players answer KQs questions and score victory points. KQ announces the winner at the end of the game.

Electronic: You need an electronic Tiptoi pen for the game.

Name: Dice Baseball
Description: "Dice Baseball" is a game that expresses the psychological warfare between a batter and a pitcher. It is realistic and immersive because it uses the pitcher's pitch and batter's batting method used in baseball. The batter and pitcher secretly select the card and open it at the same time. Locate the bat and the ball. If the bat matches the ball, the batter wins, the batter rolls the dice and follows the result. If the bat and the ball do not match, the pitcher wins, the pitcher rolls the dice and follows the result. Your choice can lead the team to victory!

Name: The Ninth World: A Skillbuilding Game for Numenera – The Beyond Pack
Description:
A set of 55 regions cards from beyond the Steadfast. This set features the regions in these kingdoms: The Black Riage, The Caecilian Jungle, The Plains of Kataru, Seshar, The Frozen South, The Cloudcrystal Skyfields, Lostrei the Spiritlands, Vralk the Red Kingdom, Corao, The Lands of the Dawn, and The Rayskel Cays. This set was made available only to Kickstarter backers.

-description from designer

Name: Europa-Wettflug
Description:
The players start in Hamburg. Movement is determined by a die. The first player back in Hamburg wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
On the game board, some cities are equipped with a hidden metal strip whereas the planes are outfitted with a magnet. If a plane lands at such a city the magnet aligns with the metal strip and the nose of the plane points in the direction of the detour, marked in green on the board.

—user summary

Name: Muumien hillojahti
Description:
A flicking game in the Moomin world for ages 4 and up. You try to collect fruits and berries in a jar for Moominmamma to make jam out of.

You flick a basket along the board and if it ends on a fruit field, you collect that fruit in your jar. After you have collected all 6 different fruits, you need to flick the basket inside the Moomin house at the end of the board to win. Watch out for Hattifatteners!

Name: Lockdown!: The Game
Description:
Lockdown!: The Game is a comedy game created by James Veitch during the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic in which players try to trade cards to collect sets and loo rolls before COVID-19 ends the game. The trading mechanisms are supported by a bluffing mechanism in which players can lie about the cards they are trading.

Each player starts with seven cards from the twelve types in the game. Each turn, a player draws two additional cards, then tries to negotiate trades, e.g., "I can trade Day drinking and Online, for company and distraction." After a successful deal, players trade the cards secretly. When trading, players can lie about the cards they are offering, except the first card that they offer. Players can additionally add Loo rolls as sweeteners for the trade. If a player collects three cards in the same category, they must play this set for points.

The game ends when six COVID-19 cards are drawn, then all played sets are scored. Black cards in your sets (good events) are worth 2 points, loo rolls are 1 point, and red cards and unplayed cards are 0 points.

Name: Krazy Maze
Description:
Krazy Maze was a 1940s board game published in Australia under licence by G. N. Raymond. National Archives Australia verifies the author being an Alan Joseph Howell and John Allan who registered the game in 1943

The game was a simple spin and move mechanism where two separate paths wind through a densely illustrated picturesque landscape. When two players play each takes a separate path. The game came with a spinner, called a "spino", which displayed numbers from 1 to 8. Players take turns spinning and moving their counter the corresponding number of squares.

Some squares on each track are marked with a letter of the alphabet and a player must follow an instruction that corresponds to that letter. For example, landing on the "A" square of the left track results in the instruction "Forgotten lunch. Back to start"; landing on the B square results in "Tiger snake on road. Extra spin to get past."

The two tracks diverge at square one and rejoin at square 89. Square 90 is the last square. A player must spin the exact number to land on square 90. The first player to do this wins.

—user summary

Name: Lese-Piraten
Description: On a lonely island, the pirates found the treasure of the famous pirate Lautikus. Unfortunately, the treasure is locked! In order to open it, the kids can solve some tricky vocabulary games.

Name: Piraten-ABC mini
Description: The famous pirate Lautikus is searching for a successor. But only the strongest pirates can win. Therefore, Lautikus invented  3 games where kids should be good in remembering, be very fast and knows what to do with words. The fastest and smartest kid wins.

Name: Rechen-Piraten mini
Description: The pirates are looking for a treasure - a calculation treasures! Join in and find the two gold coins which will show the correct mathematical answer of addition, subtraction or multiplication. The arithmetic calculation disk shows, which anser is correct and which kid wins.

Name: Käpt'n Klabauter
Description:
On a little island, there is a huge gold treasure. Every pirate has some ducates in his boat and paddles to the island. But be careful - if a storm is coming or the captain appears, everything goes worse... The goal of the game is to be the first one on the island - with a little bit of tactics and some luck.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Name: Hoppelhopp
Description: Who is faster? The bird Flips or the rabbits? Flips just learned to fly and therefore challenges the rabbits. The 5 rabbits of course need to help each other to be faster than Flips. The first one to be on the final tree wins.

Name: Mafia's Night: Citizen Expansion
Description:
Citizen expansion adds 3 new citizen roles to help them cast out mafia members.
It also adds a small module, named "Representative".

Name: Mafia's Night: Contagious Expansion
Description:
A new expansion which adds a totally new independent party: Coronavirus!
This expansion adds 6 new (and some upgraded) roles and a wholly new faction with a unique win condition.

Name: Cold Cases
Description:
One of the participants plays William Wisting and sits on one side of the magnetic, vertical game board. It's your job to track down the perpetrators and bring them to justice. Every time you lead one criminal to the arrest, you must give a handcuff piece to that participant.

Other participants sit on the other side and act as criminals. When you committed your criminal acts, you left traces. Now each of you must return to the crimescene to destroy the tracks so that Wisting does not get hold of you. You start with five track cards each on hand, one track card of each color. Every time you manage to get to one of your crime scenes, you have to leave that track card to Wisting.

If you as William Wisting get rid of all your handcuffs cards first, you win. But if a criminal manages to get rid of all his track cards, he wins. Everyone plays against everyone. The criminals constantly see how Wisting moves, but Wisting does not know how the criminals move.

Wisting must be strategic and try to calculate how the criminals move on the game board.

The battle is between Wisting and the fastest criminal. Should evil or good win?

Name: Pass auf Pinguin!
Description:
It's spring and the ice begins to melt. The little penguins waddle from one ice floe to the other. Some floes melt too much so that the penguin has to jump into the water and start from the beginning again.
The player who manages to take all his penguins to the end of the ice floes wins.

Name: Ninety Minutes
Description:
A turn based football tactics game in which you control your team of players in combination with using custom formations, team tactics and your hand of highlight cards, to defeat your opponent before the end of ninety minutes.

This game is intended to replicate the excitement of match day in a turn based board game as you attempt to outscore your opponent. With numerous formations, tactics and highlight card abilities to choose from, you will need to ensure your tactics are up to the task, and hope that luck is on your side to achieve the required dice rolls to execute them effectively.

—description from the designer

Name: Mini RatzFatz: Buchstaben und Wörter
Description: The players draw cards with letters and tell a short story with as many words starting with this letter as possible. But caveat, the letter monster might come at every moment and catch some of the letters, before you can finish your story.

Name: Mini Ratzfatz: Zählen und Rechnen
Description: The cards with the images are put face up on the table. One player tells a story which contain some of the numbers or sets shown on the cards. The player who is the first one to recognize the number resp. set, gets the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Name: Mini RatzFatz: Erstes Englisch
Description: All cards are put face up on the table so that the players can see the images. One player reads an English story and the other players try to take as fast as possible the corresponding cards. A very nice game to learn a little bit of English!

Name: Exploit Zero: Hostile Takeover
Description:
Exploit Zero: HOSTILE TAKEOVER

Corporate War - Coming Soon to a Sprawl near you!

The latest Exploit Zero rule book, Hostile Takeover shifts the game away from cooperative or solo mode and lets players command their own security force in a head-to-head corporate war.

Now your elite Agents join small, multi-model tactical units: fire teams of troopers, pods of gun drones, individual specialists, and customized heavy support units. These combined forces will form the assault teams you deploy all across the urban sprawl as you plan, maneuver, and fight to take control of your rival’s corporate headquarters.

An easy to learn, fast play, open miniature table top war game for 15-28mm miniatures set in a gritty cyberpunk future.

Name: Mini RatzFatz: Sicher im Straßenverkehr
Description: The cards with the images are put face up on the table. One player tells a story about traffic rules, signs and lights which are visible on some of the cards. The player who is the first one to recognize the correct card and knows the rule, gets the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Name: UNO: WWE Card Game
Description:
UNO game with the WWE wrestling heroes from 2010.
The game is player with the normal rules except 1 special card the "Card Royal Rumble".
If 1 player plays this card like the color choice card, but each other player tries to play one card of this color as fast as possible. The player who is the fasters puts his card on the discard pile. The next player is the one left to the "Card Royal Rumble" player.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Ancient Greek City States 5thc BC
Description:
The board game Ancient Greek City States is a turn based economic and war game, for 2 to 4 players, set during the 5thc B.C in southern Greece. The game includes 1 map of Southern Greece 32” x 36” at 8 miles to the inch, circa 5thc B.C., 1,680 economic chits, 1,960 military and control chits, 760 number counters, 3 player aids, Greek money and 4-6sided and 4-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play various city states providing the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of the 5thc BC. See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher

Name: The First Crusade 1096 to 1099
Description:
"The First Crusade: 1096 to 1099" is a turn based wargame, for 2 to 11 players, set during the 11the Century A.D. in the Levant area of the Middle East. The game includes 1 map of the Levant 36” x 48” at 24 miles to the inch, circa 11thc A.D., 1,540 military and control counters printed on both sides, player aids, medieval Bezants counters, 3-6 sided and 3-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play the Crusaders, Byzantines, Lesser Armenians, Seljuk Turks, Other Muslims and the Fatimids of Egypt. This wargame can provide the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of the 11thc A. D.. 
See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher

Name: The Age of Iron & Steel 1870 to 1929
Description:
The board game The Rise of the Iron & Steel Industry of the United States and Canada is a turn based economic game set in the late 19thc and early 20thc in the eastern USA and southern Canada. The game includes 1 map of the eastern USA and Canada 36” x 48” at 28 miles to the inch, circa 1920’s A. D., 3,200 number counters to record your sites, 50 pages of commodity charts listed by state, multiple player aids and 4-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play various sectors of the Iron and Steel industry and their related finished products providing the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of the Iron & Steel industry in the late 19thc and early 20thc United States and Canada. The price does not include shipping and handling. See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher

Name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Gazelle Mini Ship Pack
Description:
The Gazelle Close Escort was originally designed as an anti-piracy and customs enforcement vessel, with hundreds still in service with the Imperial and Planetary navies.  The ship is also popular with small mercenary and private security companies, prized for its robust construction and durability.

This mini ship pack includes 11 cards:

1x Gazelle Close Escort Ship Card

2x Red Team Adventure Card

2x Weapons Testing Adventure Card

3x Drop Capsules Upgrade Card

3x RVD Superdense Armor Upgrade Card

The Gazelle Close Escort mini ship deck is not a standalone product, additional cards are required to play Traveller.

The Traveller Customizable Card Game is a licensed adaptation of Marc Miller's classic science-fiction role-playing game of commerce, exploration and adventure in the Far Future.

Name: The Industrial Revolution in the Southern New England Area 1830 to 1889
Description:
The board game The Southern New England Manufacturing Game is a turn based economic game set in the 19thc Southern New England and Hudson Valley NY area. The game includes 1 map of the Southern New England 36” x 48” at 4.85 miles to the inch, circa 1880’s A. D., 3,040 number counters to record your sites, 172 pages of commodity charts listed by product, multiple player aids and 4-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play various industrial sectors providing the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of each industry of the 19thc in Southern New England. The price of the game does not include shipping costs. See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars:  Snack Time Game
Description:
It's snack time!

Launch squishy frogs through The Child's mouth-to the player on the other side.  You both race to clear your side of all frogs and the first one to do so wins!

Don't take turns.  You both launch squishy frogs at the same time!

Any frogs that arrive on your side must be sent back before you can win.  So keep launching as fast as you can!

This is the way!

-description from the back of the box

Name: Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – USS Enterprise NCC-1701-E Starter Set
Description:
Based on the Star Trek TNG First Contact movie. Five Rings Publishing Group released the game in a Federation and Borg starter pack.

This is the USS Enterprise NCC-1701-E Starter Set
This Federation set contains all one player needs to explore and defend Starfleet
25 assorted 20mm polyhedral dice; three 6-sided, five 8-sided, six 10-sided, seven 12-sided and four 20-sided dice
The dice control your ship's warp core, reserve power, shield strength, phasers, quantum torpedos, damage control, impulse power and sensors
A full-color ship Bridge/control panel from which you command ship systems and personnel
A full color ship shield and icon chart, and a 24 page Basic Training(TM) instruction book and rules.

—user summary

Name: Hold The Fort
Description:
Hold The Fort is a quick-fire strategy card game for 2 to 6 players where you are the commander of your fortress and your cards are your army of heroes.

Before the game starts, players are randomly dealt a Fortress Card and four to six Hero Cards. Players then choose two Hero Cards from their hand to defend their fortress with. These cards are placed face down in front of their fortress and the game begins. On a player’s turn, they take one of three actions; recruit, defend, or attack.

To recruit, a player picks a card from the draw pile. If they draw a Hero Card, it is added to their hand. If they draw a Chaos Card, the scenario described on the card takes effect.

To defend, a player takes a Hero Card from their hand and bolsters their defence by placing it next to their existing defenders.

To attack, a player takes up to three Hero Cards from their hand and lays siege to another player’s fortress. They roll the Dice of The Fates to see if their heroes receive a boon or a penalty. The total score of all attacking and defending cards is then calculated and it is determined whether the attack failed or succeeded.

On a failed attack, the defending player wins the Hero Cards that unsuccessfully attacked them. On a successful attack, the attacking player wins the defeated defending Hero Cards. The defending player then attempts to rebuild their defence with any Hero Cards from their hand.

When a player no longer has any Hero Cards to defend their fortress with, their Fortress is conquered and they are out of the game.

The last player left standing wins!

-description from designer

Name: Chocim. Potęga Husarii
Description:
"Chocim. PotÄ™ga Husarii" (Chocim. The might of the Hussars) is a wargame for 2 players, focusing on the epic battle of Chocim, fought in 1621 between the forces of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth and of the Ottoman Empire.

The struggle lasting several weeks and consisting both of pitched battles, as well as of skirmishes and siege actions ended in a stalemate and to a truce. The besieged Polish-Lithuanian forces prevailed and managed to stop a further Ottoman expansion North.

One of the players will take control of the more numerous Ottoman forces and his objective will be to break through the Polish fortifications and take control of the main Polish encampment.

The player controlling the Commonwealth forces will be defending his fortress at all costs at the same time trying to bring down enemy morale to a level at which it will refuse to keep on fighting.

If neither side achieves their objective on the battlefield before the end of the 5th turn the game is decided upon a diplomatic clash when both players will use their diplomacy assets acquired throughout the game.

Name: Is It Me? Is It You?
Description:
Is It Me? Is It You? is a social game for two players (best with BFFs or partners) to determine how much you have been paying attention to the other player's quirks.

Players take turns reading out one of 100 questions (example: "Which of us is more likely to lock themselves out of the house?"). Both players then simultaneously hold up their paddles--marked on opposite sides with "Me" and "You"--to indicate which of them they feel is the best answer to the question. Point are awarded accordingly.

Name: What The Plot?!
Description:
"A party game for people who like to talk sh*t."

Ever wanted to tell your friends how you lost your eyebrows or about the time you had dinner with aliens? Well, now is your chance!

Take a Prompt card. Take a Word card. You now have one minute to bullsh*t a story. After the minute is up, the player next to you has to continue your story and so on!

If a player doesn't use one of the three words on the Word card, fails to complete the challenge, can't bullsh*t a story (ex. says uhhhh a lot), or gets booed, they will have to keep the Word card or Boo card.

The first player to collect three cards is a terrible bullsh*tter and the story ends. The player who is not the worst wins!

Name: Ice Cream You Scream!
Description:
ICE CREAM YOU SCREAM! is a family game for all ages where you each own a competing ice cream shop. You roll 7 dice to dish out ice cream cones complete with whipped cream and a cherry on top. Players roll up to seven dice per turn trying to build their treat with a flavored cone, cherry, whipped cream, and 1-4 specific scoops to score points. As long as one die on your roll can build onto the cone you've started, you can keep rolling to complete it or risk your progress to add more scoops and freeze out your opponents. Push your luck too far and you'll end up with brain freeze and find your chances of victory dropping precipitously.
Once one player has sold cones of all four flavors, whoever has sold the most total scoops wins!
